column4: unfortunately I can't... this is a test machine for QA of updates and scripts for a game server, and the live box runs v8
might be of interest too you http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=659118, no solution there unfortunately
what happens when you try to connect to the network?
does it Connect to the wireless network ok?
with eth0 (wired nic) it works instantly. It appears to connect, at least iwconfig claims that it is seeing the SSID and the AP.
is there a network icon in the top right that you can use to connect to wireless networks?  (i don't remember 8.04 very well)
there is... I used it to config the card and it looks fine, but the card never receives an IP.
IP comes after connecting to the wireless network, which is step 1

what wireless security are you using?  have you put in the passkey/phrase into the wireless connection setting?  there must be a way to actually try to connect to wireless networks - do you see a list anywhere?
open WEP, and there's a place to enter the key in that network config section. I've done this, both as a hex value and as ascii (it gives me an option to do either).
open WEP?  what do you mean
what happens when you run "sudo dhclient ath0" right now?
sorry man i don't have any other ideas?
thanks, I appreciate the help.. maybe I'll try moving up to 9.04 and see if it causes a shitstorm with the QA team.
